geovctrs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

geovctrs

The goal of geovctrs is to provide a common set of classes and data structures to ensure that processing functions in the rapidly expanding R geospatial ecosystem are interchangable.

Installation

You can install the development version from GitHub with:

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("paleolimbot/geovctrs")

If you can load the package, youâre good to go!

library(geovctrs)

Example

This package has reasonable plot() and print() methods for WKB and WKT types, and provides a vctrs implementation for these types so that they âjust workâ with tibble, tidyr, and dplyr (>=1.0.0) (among others).

geo_wkt("LINESTRING (30 10, 10 30, 40 40)")
#> <geo_wkt[1]>
#> [1] LINESTRING (30 10, 10 30, 40 40)
as_geo_wkb(geo_wkt("LINESTRING (30 10, 10 30, 40 40)"))
#> <geo_wkb[1]>
#> [1] <LINESTRING>{3} (10 10...40 40)
tibble(wkt = geo_wkt("LINESTRING (30 10, 10 30, 40 40)"))
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>   wkt                   
#>   <wkt>                 
#> 1 </>{3} (10 10...40 40)

Most methods work on anything that can be interpreted as geometry, including character vectors and data.frames containing exactly one geometry column.

geo_plot("LINESTRING (30 10, 10 30, 40 40)")

Like any self-respecting geometry package, geovctrs contains a copy of the North Carolina dataset to play with:

rev(geo_nc)
#> # A tibble: 100 x 12
#>    geometry                                              NWBIR79 SID79
